post.body: my wife applied and got interviewed by Krypton Factor. Mmmm my wife in spandex...mmm...I digress!
Or were you talking about the API browser...?
Yeah, I think I need a bit of design input. Style currently stolen from jquery.com, with the exception of the green!
Try Safari - hence the line at the bottom of the example! :-)
Damn, rs.com was running from a slightly older version. I've re-up'd and 'sib' returns correct results. Cheers!
Which API browser had the search "siblings" to find traversing - or is that docs.jquery? Agree on click, I'll add my keys JS ;-)
It was written initially, specifically as AIR, but it looks good enough to stand as a browser version too.
Sorry, that should have been http://redyoursite.com - I wrote the JS to do the highlighting work, easy to implement too.
It's a 40 minute walk and about 1 or 2 degrees out. I made bus man take my money by threatening to serenade him.
no, just go to redmysite.com and there's a script.
I assume you are, but wanted to check: are you open on this cold winters afternoon?
I'm afraid by sites are all down due to ropy SQL issue: jsbin, J4D, rs.com, et al. :-( won't be up for a few hours until I get home.
API: Filter & Find http://tinyurl.com/8r72fl
Just posted the first in the API series for J4D. I'm purposely avoiding $.ajax for the short term, but it's definitely on the books.
http://twitpic.com/1055z - New cards arrived today (new iPhone = new number), this was the tech "in joke" I was most proud of
Just written possibly the longest comment on my own site. Probably good grounds for a blog post: http://tr.im/2znu
CSS Tricks' Link Nudge http://tinyurl.com/7sun8g
Preview of upcoming jQuery API browser: http://remysharp.com/jquery-api2/ love to hear your feedback.
Had to head home and give up on @geminiupstairs bus driver gave me jip about paying the fare with a tenner. Why can't Oyster work down here?
Snow's falling again, while I sit in a cool little cafe and cracking in to a Welsh Rarebit later :-)
